    Running BHM for GlobalMass

    run_bhm_gic.Rmd

    If you haven’t run through the Quickstart tutorial already, please do so before continuing. You’ll also need to have run through the GlobalMass GIC Data Pre-processing tutorial

    Input files

    We first need the input files we created in the previous tutorial. Hopefully your intermediate_data folder looks like this

    ls intermediate_data

    If it doesn’t, please go back and make sure you’ve run through each step of the tutorial.

    Files and arguments

    In this tutorial we’ll run the BHM on some glacier and icesheet (GIC) data. This means we need paths to the data files in the intermediate_data/GIC folder to pass into the run_bhm_gic function.

    ?run_bhm_gic

    On my computer I have the data folder in my home directory under 4D_modeller. Let’s start with creating the paths to each of the files.

    mesh_filepath <- "mesh_GIC.Rds"
data_filepath <- "EWH_GSFC_grace_global_GMGIA_to2015.RData"
grace_data_filepath <- "grace_data.RData"

    We also need to select the GRACE data centre we want to use, we have a choice of GSFC or JPL. As you can see in the filename of data_filepath we’re using GSFC data here, so we set GRACE_dc like so.

    GRACE_dc <- "GSFC"

    We also want to set an output_folder to save the model run summary and model outputs to. We’ll create a folder called model_output and within that a folder called GIC.

    mkdir -p model_output/GIC

    Here the -p flag to mkdir means make the parent directory and the GIC directory at once.

    Running the BHM

    We’re now ready to run the BHM.

    output_filepaths <- run_bhm_gic(mesh_filepath = mesh_filepath,
                                data_filepath = data_filepath,
                                grace_data_filepath = grace_data_filepath,
                                GRACE_dc = GRACE_dc,
                                output_folder = "model_output/GIC")

    Above we see some model run information printed to screen. This includes …

    When the function completes it returns a list of output filepaths. This makes it easy to view the output of the model.

    Examine model output

    Returned from run_bhm_gic function we get three filepaths

    output_filepaths

    The first is the glacier data, the second the glacier data in a CSV format and the third the model output in an rds file. Let’s open that file and take a look. First we take the third filepath from the list, then load the data in using readRDS.

    run_data_filepath <- output_filepaths[3]
model_run_data <- readRDS(run_data_filepath)
model_run_data

    Here we can see that…
